definition: (of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: But he did, and the dam broke.
sentences.chinese: 但他让了步，大坝决堤了。

sentences.english: Officials say muskrat holes caused that breach.
sentences.chinese: 官员表示决堤由麝香鼠洞引发。

sentences.english: Thousands relocated after river bank bursts.
sentences.chinese: 江西发生河坝决堤，数千人撤离家园。

sentences.english: Up till 130pm, I have had three emo and tearing sessions.
sentences.chinese: 截止下午一点三十分，我已经三度难过，决堤。

sentences.english: The River Frome had burst its banks after torrential rain .
sentences.chinese: 暴雨过后弗罗姆河决堤了。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
(of a watercourse) to breach its banks/(of a dam) to burst
to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
to cascade down/to flow in torrents/(fig.) outpouring (of emotions)
